chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Great Bodily Harm)
Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Great Bodily Harm)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott A Langermann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Bodily Harm), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to Probation by 4:30 p.m. on 7/7/2017.

miscConds.notes: $268.00 court costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up a payment plan.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

NO contact with ASL unless allowed through Probation in coordination with CPS.
May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  Other civil rights may be lost until restored. 
If not a U.S. Citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Scott A Langermann in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 3:38 pm.  
16CF5-AMENDED to 948.21(1)(b), Neglecting a Child.  Def-NC plea.  CT accepts plea, adj guilty & Judgment entered.  
17CT12-OWI 2nd-NC plea.  CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered.
SENTENCE:
16CF5-w/h, probation 3 yrs.  No contact with ASL dob 8/11/12 unless allowed thru probation agent in coordination w/ child protection.  $268 fine, added to PP.
Must report to Probation by 4:30 pm. on 7/7.  No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
17CT12-10 days PCJ, subj to GT & WR.  Must report within 60 days.  $1492, added to PP.  14 mo revocation/ IID.  AODA & compliance.  1 day credit.
PCR.  4:06 pm adj.
to Judge Lundell from JA dated 6-2-17
Status hearing on July 6, 2017 at 03:45 pm.
